website_summaries.verdict: A stellar waffle maker from a reputable company with a cost that's affordable, although not a "budget price.
pros: Steam-release system prevents condensation inside the machine, leading to a crispier waffle
cons: Priced a bit higher than budget models (although not the most expensive on the market.)

customer_reviews.title: The waffle maker is great. Makes awesome waffles
customer_reviews.text: The waffle maker is great. Makes awesome waffles. However, the handle was loose when I received the unit. I sent it back for repair and when I got the repaired item back, the handle was still loose. It had paperwork that said the handle was tightened, but it did not look like it had even been unpacked. I am disappointed that an item this expensive and from such a reputable company has such poor quality control and poor repair service.
customer_reviews.author: Zuker

customer_reviews.title: Great at 1st, but quickly fizzled
customer_reviews.text: When we first got this, it was fantastic. The waffles were perfectly cooked every time. Over the past couple of months, however, it has become little more than a gigantic waste of (a LOT of space) on our kitchen counter. For some reason it no longer maintains consistent temperature, so one waffle will be perfect, and the next will be a congealed mess. I reached out to All-Clad to see if they'd do anything about it, but their response was effectively "sorry about your luck." We have a $30 Cuisinart heart shaped waffle maker that at this points does a better job more consistently. Save the extra $130 and buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Wiborg

customer_reviews.title: Sadly disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to purchase this product. I already had the other All-Clad Waffle Maker, and I decided I wanted the Belgium Waffle Maker, too. However, when I received this product I was very disappointed. The very important overflow batter catch doesn’t stay in place and it makes a very difficult mess to clean up if it moves slightly out of place. The problem is that the little plastic cup doesn’t lock in place, and the cord for the device sits right underneath it, so it constantly hits the cup. The slightest touch makes the cup move, and creates a big mess.
customer_reviews.author: KatieT

customer_reviews.title: Best Waffle Maker ever
customer_reviews.text: If you are serious about waffles like I am, spend the bucks & get this one. It is the best waffle maker I have ever had. The waffles are thick with deep indentations and evenly cooked. As soon as my kids saw it, they started arguing about who should get it in my will.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Reece

customer_reviews.title: Paid full price for all-clad waffle maker and received used ...
customer_reviews.text: Paid full price for all-clad waffle maker and received used product!!! Oil and food particles on inside. No warranty card came with unit!!!
customer_reviews.author: susanbill

customer_reviews.title: Defective product
customer_reviews.text: The heating element within the product is defective....one side of the waffle cooked as specified, while the other half of the waffle remained under-cooked. The over-flow basin, while a good concept, was poorly designed, causing batter to back flow onto the holding plate for the receptacle, making clean up tedious and time consuming. A product not worthy of the All Clad name.....and certainly not worth the price i paid. I used the product one time and returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: 2 year lifespan
customer_reviews.text: It worked relatively well, fairly slow, and burned the waffle unless you took it out before the beep, but workable. Then after just under 2 years of semi-regular use the top half of the iron stopped working, no heat, half cooked waffles. All Clad should be embarrassed to have their logo on this disposable appliance.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Y. Briggs

customer_reviews.title: Owner's Manual missing
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking waffle iron but arrived with product box torn and no manual leading me to believe it might be a returned item. How do I get manual? Was unable to find contact info to call or email. Rating probably will go up once I have manual and can use correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: We ordered this after searching for the best waffle makers on youtube
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this after searching for the best waffle makers on youtube! This is a sturdy, well made product and it turns out perfect waffles every time. The Norpro 1975 Grip-EZ Grab and Life Silicone Tong is a must to pull the waffles out. We are using the waffle recipe in the All-Clad booklet, minus most of the sugar, and the waffles are so, so good. It's a little more work because you have to whip the egg whites. If you don't have time for that, you can just use Pioneer Baking Mix to create a decent facsimile!
customer_reviews.author: Potter

customer_reviews.title: You’ll love it
customer_reviews.text: This is the waffle maker of my dreams. I’ve aspired to afford this for a few years and finally ordered one for my family for Christmas and I’m so happy that I did. I’ve tried some bargain waffle makers since my last good one broke and they were all disappointing. This waffle maker makes crisp, fluffy, golden waffles that are just the best. I butter all the waffles that come out while they’re hot so they have a little softness when served.
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten

customer_reviews.title: I would  recommend  this iron to anyone  who is serious  about  great waffles!
customer_reviews.text: Third time is a charm! I tried other less expensive waffle irons but you truly get what you pay for. This AllClad is finally what I was looking for. A made in the USA product that makes perfectly cooked waffles, light and fluffy inside, crispy on the outside. I have had good results using gluten free flour as well as whole wheat. I always yeast my waffles too, it gives extra lightness and flavor. Love that it stores upright, saving space. I used no spray and waffle is easy to remove with a small silicone spatula.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L. Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Makes genuine Belgian waffles
customer_reviews.text: This makes the real Belgian waffle ... big and deep. It's 4 squares easily feed two of us and we have to be hungry. Heavy and durable. Had to clear a shelf to store it in my cupboard because it was too tall to stand up. Definitely pleased with purchase. My husband is something of a waffle fanatic and has them at least 3 times a week.
customer_reviews.author: Peterson

customer_reviews.title: I can't thank you enough for your customer service expertise and since I've been a customer of yours for over 7 years I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this; not only because of it's superb cooking quality and short cooking time but because it's fantastically well built! When I received the original one on 2/2/2018 it was missing the drip tray and usage guide and after I reported it you ordered me a new one that I received today ( 2/4/2018 ) that came with everything. I returned the original one yesterday per UPS . I can't thank you enough for your service and I give this waffle maker more than 110% excellent quality!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jean's ponies

customer_reviews.title: The One
customer_reviews.text: After many years with a variety of lesser wafflers, I think I've finally found The One. Makes beautiful, even waffles. Easy to clean with no spillover. Don't omit the oil in your recipe and you won't need to oil the plates. Waffles pop out easily and leave no mess behind. It's heavy. Really, a beast. The shell does get hot and takes a long time to cool down. I can live with that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Follow up
customer_reviews.text: Update: I checked eBay filtering for used waffle irons. Scanned the first few pages of results. Lot's of 'All-Clad' units but no Brevilles. Apparently people keep them.
customer_reviews.author: Rogue

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I make waffles for my wife every weekday morning and we often eat sourdough waffles for weekend lunch. As result I regularly kill cheap iron every two years or so. When my last one died I decided to splurge and buy this Rolls-Royce of waffle makers. After a couple month of intensive use my impression is positive. The waffles are now much crispier and even. I like the locking feature. The iron feels very sturdy and well build. The only disappointment is the overflow container. It feels cheap and does not stay on place when I move the iron even slightly. Cannot say anything about durability yet, but based on price it must last at least 10 years. :)
customer_reviews.author: Grisha

customer_reviews.title: Sad
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to clean. Inconsistent quality. Waffles aren’t much better than a cheap waffle maker. Sad and disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: SOP

customer_reviews.title: ... it for a few months now and have done sweet and savory waffles
customer_reviews.text: Have had it for a few months now and have done sweet and savory waffles,all have have been delicious and perfectly cooked.I was surprised how hot this iron cooks I have yet to take it off the #1 setting.The finish lives up to All Clad quality. I have graters that require more effort to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Bohannon

customer_reviews.title: The World’s Best Waffle Iron
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this waffle iron! It is the epitome of all waffle irons. It gets super hot and releases moisture, leaving you with a perfectly crispy on the outside, soft on the inside waffle. Be forewarned, it may be a bit difficult to clean if you add anything to the batter due to the deep wells (but totally worth it). I recommend setting the temperature at a 2 or 3...then increasing as needed (this thing gets really hot). Batter Additive Suggestion: pearl sugar Recipe Suggestion: yeast waffles with pearl sugar Cleanup Hint: sprinkle additive along the top of the batter just after pouring in the iron in lieu of mixing together ahead of time.
customer_reviews.author: Aubrey Lohrman

customer_reviews.title: Built like a tank, it's All-Clad after all.  Makes a great waffle
customer_reviews.text: It's a great waffle maker and does what its intended to do. It's extremely well built as you would expect an All-Clad product to be. Certainly not a budget waffle maker. It cooks very evenly and temperature was confirmed via a thermal image from a FLIR camera. The built in pre-heat and cooking completed audio notification is a nice touch. The only thing missing from the design of this unit is the lack of removable inserts to enable easier cleaning. While non-stick It would still be beneficial to be able to clean the grates from time to time. Also a nice design consideration is that it can be stored vertically which keeps its footprint much smaller.
customer_reviews.author: C. Chan

customer_reviews.title: WAFFLE HEAVEN
customer_reviews.text: got it yest'd, used this am...started on #6 setting, pleasant aroma-brown-crisp edges-cooked airy inner; second set done on #5 setting, golden brown, perfect to pop in toaster tomorrow. tongs very helpful...so impressed that clumsy me was able to do this successfully 1st try! INDULGE YOURSELF - GET 1!!!
customer_reviews.author: DIVA1

customer_reviews.title: Perfect waffles every time
customer_reviews.text: We've had one of these for years. The waffles come out perfect, crispy outside, soft and fluffy inside, delicious! The key to perfection is using a spray-on oil. We use organic coconut oil. Without the spray, the waffles stick to the waffle-maker. Our waffles are so popular with the family that we got another 2-waffle-maker from Amazon. Some users say the 4-waffle unit heats unevenly, so we decided it would be better to have two of the 2-waffle units. This has worked out just great.
customer_reviews.author: Patto

customer_reviews.title: High quality waffle maker.
customer_reviews.text: I received this a a few days ago and I’m extremely happy with the purchase. The waffles come out crispy and fluffy. The unit itself is high quality and will probably last years. The two waffle maker is perfect because it can be stored vertically and takes very little space. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Salil Bhatnagar

customer_reviews.title: Great waffle maker
customer_reviews.text: The design of this is just the best. Easy to use but most importantly easy to clean! On my first attempt, I accidently overfilled the trough and it oozed out everywhere. The messy was super easy to clean up and there is a catch basin in the back. The waffles came out perfect. With the 4 slots, it makes for quicker serving for a large family.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Great waffles, not great on washing up
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic waffles! Only wish they designed it so we could take the waffle plates out for cleaning, it’s a beast to wash over the sink. Am always afraid I’m getting water in places it doesn’t belong. Drying after is also tricky, I try to get dish cloths in there but then I still need to flip it over and let it air dry. Good thing the waffles are more than worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Ali Ivmark

customer_reviews.title: Restaurant Quality!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing waffle maker. Love the deep pockets that it makes for big, thick waffles. Excellent part is that it is so easy to use. Set the dial for the darkness desired, and the maker chimes to let you know when the waffles are done. Waffles have come out evenly cooked each time. Very sturdy product. Worth the investment if you love waffles!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Empty waffle maker smokes when preheating
customer_reviews.text: The waffle maker started to smoke during preheating after a month . Teflon becomes carcinogenic when overheated. All-Clad does not honor the consumer satisfaction warranty, so if you don't return it to amazon in time, you're out of luck. Beware.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Never knew waffles could be so impressive
customer_reviews.text: This thing pumps out masterpieces by the minute. I've only used King Arthur's GF pancake mix so far, and I've been eating WAY TOO MANY waffles since getting this thing. If you like waffles, I can't imagine finding a better waffle maker than this one. Plus, it's kinda gorgeous and classy and stores upright and out of the way. I love cool/quirky kitchen appliances; this one's quite impressive. I kinda wish the plates came off for cleaning, but I use a soft brush and it's totally fine.
customer_reviews.author: RoverTFord

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Belgian Waffle Maker
customer_reviews.text: Best Belgian waffle maker. It produce crispy waffle on the outside but fluffy on the inside. Still going strong after three and half years...one of the best investment on the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Jusak

customer_reviews.title: Have used it about six times now and we are very pleased with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: This waffle maker is well worth the money. Heats quickly and evenly and is well made. Have used it about six times now and we are very pleased with this purchase. Depending on your recipe, you will need to determine just how much batter to use. The recommended 1/3 cup doesn't always work. The overflow cup does help. There will be some possible trial and error. Nothing wrong with that though. You still get some delicious waffles. We like our waffles nicely browned, so we have been using 4 or 5 on the dial. That may also depend on your particular recipe.
customer_reviews.author: dubnovich

customer_reviews.title: Finally Deep pocket waffles
customer_reviews.text: My goal was deep pocket wells of syrup and that is what I got - true Belgian waffles. Perfectly crisp, or semi-crisp or soft - how do you like them. Easy control allows you to pick. The handy overflow bucket makes cleanup easy. Highly recommend but expensive. Search the web for better pricing. After I purchased, found it for less.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is expensive but you get what you pay for... perfection
customer_reviews.text: It is perfect. Stores flat or standing upright. Cooks waffles perfectly, just be sure to wait for it to beep after removing waffles so it is preheated. Nothing sticks to the waffle irons. The stainless steel is easy to clean after it cools. No need to turn it as both sides of the waffles are evenly cooked
customer_reviews.author: alisha woolery

customer_reviews.title: Works as promised, very steep learning curve.
customer_reviews.text: Good waffle maker for the price, but seriously confusing "simplicity". The twin lights on the front and a family who didn't read the instructions made for an entertaining sight, but even after they figured out how it worked they were having troubles interpreting the lights and how they worked along with the buzzer. Super steep learning curve for using it, but it makes great waffles.
customer_reviews.author: Ian McGhee

customer_reviews.title: Try It, You’ll Like It
customer_reviews.text: Two yummy waffles is all I need to cook at a time, we like ‘em hot & fresh off the grid Find your favorite recipe and apply some extra calories...and you’ll be smiling all day Worth the price and small enough to keep on the counter. Try it ...you’ll like it !
customer_reviews.author: DCP

customer_reviews.title: Best waffles ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the best waffle iron I have ever owned. I liked it so much that I bought one for my parents, daughters, and sister too. I was a little disappointed to discover that it, unlike allclad pans, was not made in USA, but that’s hardly unique to this item. Maybe some day they’ll repatriate manufacturing. I would happily pay more for a domestic product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: It is such a joy to use well-made kitchen appliances
customer_reviews.text: It is such a joy to use well-made kitchen appliances! This waffle maker is fantastic! It is built like a tank and works exactly as expected. Nice and deep and truly non-stick, it makes beautiful Belgian waffles! The whole machine is very attractive as well; it looks really cute on my counter top!
customer_reviews.author: K. P.

customer_reviews.title: Waffle perfection
customer_reviews.text: My only regret in purchasing this waffle maker is that I didn't get the 4-square. It makes perfect waffles every time--crisp with just the right thickness. Because of this, I think they freeze well too. One thing to remember, if you get it, the batter run-off cup is tucked away in the styrofoam packaging. I almost threw mine away.
customer_reviews.author: amylorraine

customer_reviews.title: Best One Yet
customer_reviews.text: We keep trying waffle makers (there in the last 5 years). This is the first one that makes crispy Belgium waffles. It is pricy and heavy but the results so far are great. If you love waffles, get this.
customer_reviews.author: An Ohio Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Great machine
customer_reviews.text: This is a big waffle iron that make big deep waffles! I find that I have to use a bit more batter for a waffle than in other machines which is to be expected. Just make sure to take that into account when making waffles for a crowd. You will likely not get as many as your recipe calls for. The 7 browning settings are perfect I typically use 5 sometimes 7 for my keto waffles. Haven’t tried and regular Waffles in here yet but I bet they would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Justin S. Hair

customer_reviews.title: The waffles are delicious.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 19 year old son and he is over the moon with it. He makes waffles that are out of this world.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Brown

customer_reviews.title: Lasted about 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Worked OK at first. Then undercooked the waffles. They came out soft and soggy. That went on for a couple of weeks. Then the thermostat got stuck on and it got very hot and burned the waffles to a crisp. Not what you expect from a $200 All Clad Waffle maker. I am in the process of contacting them for return.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Murphy

customer_reviews.title: All-Clad Belgian Waffle Maker
customer_reviews.text: It's sleek and beautiful! Quite heavy due to the high quality. It's relatively easy to clean just by adding hot water and scooping away particles, but has to be well balanced when emptying the water due to the weight of it. It browns the waffle very well and even on the highest setting it does not burn. I'm happy with my purchase :-)
customer_reviews.author: Courtney R King

customer_reviews.title: The Best Belgium Waffle Maker
customer_reviews.text: Our old All-Clad started showing its age after more than 10 years, though it still worked. Purchased this replacement and things look great. Perfect waffles and easy, for a waffle maker, to clean and is extremely reliable. Very much worth the price if one frequently has waffles, as in our case on a weekly basis.
customer_reviews.author: Wombat Warlord

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. It would be nice if the lid floated a bit more to keep the sandwiches from sliding. Wish the plates were removable to clean. We use it every day and really like it. Nice unit
customer_reviews.author: susan d.

customer_reviews.title: Cooks great!!
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this a lot for waffles and chaffles. Works great, has stand up storage, cooks wonderful with clear indicators. Hope to use it for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: J. Tune

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased!
customer_reviews.text: Love the size of the waffle maker! Was able to make a huge pile of waffles to feed 7! Love the ability to be notified when the waffles were ready and to be able to adjust how done with the 7 levels of finish. My only complaint would be the cost but as another review stated you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.author: roger

customer_reviews.title: Waffles stick.
customer_reviews.text: Waffles stick to the top plate every time even though I brush both plates with vegetable oil. I didn’t have this problem with the still working inexpensive Belgium waffle iron I used for about 20 years. The appliance does produce nice deep waffles, although a bit dry.
customer_reviews.author: ezreader

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, deep waffles
customer_reviews.text: It is pricey but it makes gorgeous waffles with a dial that lets you set how crisp and brown you want your waffle. Easy to use and looks nice on the kitchen counter.
customer_reviews.author: HM

customer_reviews.title: Great waffle maker
customer_reviews.text: Great waffle maker, does not need oil on the griddles the waffles come right off. Waffles have the right amount of crunch on the outside and soft and moist (never dry) on the inside.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael Carrillo Jr.

customer_reviews.title: I love their cookware and haven't been disappointed with this waffle ...
customer_reviews.text: We tried other waffle makers from family members that worked, but went with the All Clad. I love their cookware and haven't been disappointed with this waffle maker. The catch-cup in the back catches any run-off if I overfill the tray. Love the audible alarm that tells me the waffles are done. It makes wonderful belgian waffles and requires very little storage space. I test waffle makers that flip over - while they are easier to get the waffle out, they require a lot of storage space and they cooked so fast that my yeast-based waffles weren't completely done in the middle.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Brown

customer_reviews.title: This has a lot of great features. The consistency of the waffle is great ...
customer_reviews.text: This has a lot of great features. The consistency of the waffle is great each and every time. Other great features are the locks to keep the lid closed during storage, the drip tray in the back easily clips on and off, and lastly the timer on cook time is great. This is a very heavy unit, even for a two waffle maker but worth the money spent since I know we will have this for quite a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Chicago Reader

customer_reviews.title: Broke within two years
customer_reviews.text: All Clad is a company we have always trusted to make high quality long lasting products. Our waffle iron, used maybe 15 times in the two years we've had it, stopped working today. We are really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: True Belgian waffles
customer_reviews.text: Batter wipes off easily, but there’s no easy way to get crumbs out from the deep waffle iron grid (it’s too heavy to lift, tilt, and wipe). Still, makes beautiful waffles and looks lovely while doing it.
customer_reviews.author: J A Homestead

customer_reviews.title: but I love the overflow cup in the back
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy unit, but I love the overflow cup in the back. This keeps the iron clean, and the cup is easy to clean and replace. Waffles are great too.
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied ButtKicker User

customer_reviews.title: High quality product.
customer_reviews.text: Lights show when it's time to cook, lights show when it's finished. What more is there? Produces a crisp exterior and soft interior. Have made both Belgian and Liege waffles without flaws.
customer_reviews.author: Rick37

customer_reviews.title: Waffles
customer_reviews.text: This is built solid, used it numerous times and each time the waffles comes out with raving reviews. It is heavy and if you are one to move this all the time may want to make sure you are okay with this. I like the weight because it doesn't move on my granite counter and it is very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds expectations
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS APPLIANCE!! Easy to use, easy to clean and easy to store. The drip catcher really does work and the waffles turn out perfectly cooked. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: I Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: WAFFLES ANYONE?
customer_reviews.text: Did a ton of product research on ALL waffle makers, Belgian and otherwise. This had the consistent and highest reviews. It's GREAT!! All-Clad a bit pricey, but always worth it. Will last a lifetime instead of having to replace very couple of years as with cheaper models.
customer_reviews.author: Sally Wilbanks

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: We make waffles on Sunday. Prior to the All-Clad, we had a much cheaper product (from reputable brand) which produced very inconsistent waffles. The All-Clad, on the other hand, makes perfect waffles every time. Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Roundle

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I wished I would have bought it along time ago!!
customer_reviews.author: Laya

customer_reviews.title: But I love love love it
customer_reviews.text: Yes, I spent this much on a waffle iron. But I love love love it. The timing feature works absolutely perfectly. The heat control is a fantastic feature. The past two years I've been taking Pinterest suggestions to use a waffle iron for more than just waffles. My old iron didn't have heat setting, so some of those Pinterest trials were errors. Not anymore-- cinnamon rolls ✅ brownies ✅ hash browns ✅ eggs ✅ nice deep waffles ✅✅
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent waffles but challenging to clean
customer_reviews.text: The iron heats up very fast and the waffles turn out great, but cleaning takes a few passes to make sure all the crumbs and oil have been removed. With the handle, it can be somewhat bulky to store - it can be stored on its side but it's definitely not as secure.
customer_reviews.author: Schiel Harman

customer_reviews.title: Delicious True Belgian Waffle Maker
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing waffle maker! I bought one for my mom as a gift, and the waffles were delicious that I bought one for myself. Definitely recommend even though the clean up may not be the easiest.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Everything it's cracked up to be
customer_reviews.text: This is everything it's cracked up to be. Perfect waffles first time out. About 1/3 cup of batter per side works just right. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Arconti

customer_reviews.title: Makes amazing waffles
customer_reviews.text: Love the product. It is sturdy, easy to use, and I appreciate the different settings so you can decide on the crispiness of your waffles. It holds a lot of batter and they come out perfect each and every time. The only issue is cleaning it is a bit challenging since the plates don't pop out (which I knew when I bought it). However, it is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Can’t clean the grates with ease
customer_reviews.text: Great two waffle maker machine. Horrible to clean. Grates don’t come out so you have to clean by hand with a rag. The waffles are fairly big, as in deep, roughly 2.5 cm in thickness. The ease of use if great. Dump some product in. Have the desired coolness (usually go 3) and wait until beeping.
customer_reviews.author: B. McIntyre

customer_reviews.title: If you love waffles
customer_reviews.text: Best waffle maker I ve ever had . Makes the perfect waffle and very easy to use . Two waffles take 3 mins and cooked perfect.
customer_reviews.author: J. Movius

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful kitchen appliance
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful kitchen appliance. Very sturdy and heavy. Waffles turned out great. However, I would look for one that could turn over so the waffle could be cooked (browned) evenly.
customer_reviews.author: sb

customer_reviews.title: Good Waffle Maker
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a good waffle maker. Heavy which to means it will hold heat better as batter is poured in meaning that it is better designed to get that crisp outside. Somewhat hard to clean, but most waffle makers are. It stores on its side, which makes it easy to store in our cupboard.

customer_reviews.title: Great Waffle Maker

product_meta.title: All-Clad 99011GT Stainless Steel Belgian Waffle Maker with 7 Browning Settings, 2-Square, Silver
product_meta.description: Style Name:2-SquareYou can bake two square-shaped Belgian waffles with this All-Clad 99011GT Belgian waffle maker to enjoy during weekend brunches, for delicious desserts or even as a snack. The waffle maker’s advanced heating technology ensures consistent baking and browning, while its steam-release system prevents condensation from building-up so you can enjoy waffles bake to perfection: delicately crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside. The waffles measure 4.5 inches wide by 1-inch thick, with easy-to-cut sections, and have extra-deep pockets for capturing jam, sugar, chocolate, fresh fruits, and other favorite toppings.The red indicator light lets you know that your waffle maker is preheating and an audible beep tells you when when it is properly preheated. Then simply pour in the batter, close the lid, and turn the knob to adjust the temperature. The green indicator light, along with an audible beep, lets you know when the waffles have finished baking. This waffle maker is also easy to clean thanks to its non-stick cooking surface. Housed in polished stainless steel with a branded die-cast handle, this strong waffle maker ensures long-lasting performance while beautifully complementing All-Clad stainless-steel cookware for a cohesively stunning collection. Other highlights include a removable drip tray, integrated cord storage, and a locking lid for convenient upright storage. Enjoy the sweeter side of life with All-Clad.
feature_bullets: Shade/Browning selection dial with 7 different settings to accommodate every taste
Steam-release system for crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside waffles
Ready to cook and ready to eat LED indicator lights to let you know when to pour your batter in and when your waffles are ready to eat
Nonstick cooking surface and removable drip tray provide effortless release and quick, easy cleanup
Easy-to-cut sections and extra-deep pockets to enjoy your waffles with any type of topping
